isis.stitle: TSI 99-08-01 - Day Time Running Light (DRL) Module in U.S. and Canadian Vehicles with Lift-To- Dim Relay Buzz and/or Failure

subjectgroup.subject: Day Time Running Light (DRL) Module in U.S. and Canadian Vehicles with Lift-To- Dim Relay Buzz and/or Failure

geninfo.para: The day time running lights (DRL) with the lift to dim relay in 1652 SC, 2000, 3800, 4000 and 8000 Models built before May 1, 1999 could experience electrical feedback and cause the relay to vibrate or buzz. To correct the relay vibrate/buzz or should the relay fail, perform the service procedure that follows.

warning.para: To prevent severe injury to the eyes, face, limbs and body, it is imperative that lighted tobacco, flames or sparks be kept away from the vent openings of the battery. The gas mixture in the battery cells, which escapes through the vents, could ignite and/or cause an explosion. Always wear safety glasses and a face shield when working near batteries to prevent personal injury.

step1.para: Disconnect the negative cable(s) from the battery terminal.
Locate lift-to-dim relay coil circuit 51C (16YL) at terminal 3 of connector 274 ( Figure 1).
Remove circuit wire 51C from terminal 3 by clipping it off as close as possible to the terminal. Install a new terminal end to circuit wire 51C.
Relocate circuit 51C to terminal 4 on headlight switch connector 35 ( Figure 2).
Reconnect the negative cable(s) to the battery terminal.
